result.execSummary:
The defendant John F Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

supervisions.notes: AMENDED 03-08-2017 TO ADD RESTITUTION PER STIPULATION OF PARTIES AND ORDER OF THE COURT.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.   Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with former employer, brother and sister in law, and chiropractic agency unless approved by them and agent. Comply with all child support orders. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Restitution must be paid during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  AMENDED 04-07-2017:  Restitution ordered joint and several with co-defendant, K.S.

timeConds.notes: Credit for time served to be applied only in the event of revocation. With Huber for employment. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant John F Anderson in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State has no corrections or additions to PSI.  Chapter 950 compliant.  
Defense has no corrections or additions to PSI. 

State requests an imposed and stayed prison sentence with 3-4 years probation, 120 days conditional time in RCJ.
Defense requests the same only a shorter probation time.  Requests a restitution hearing.

BTC:  on 1660 - withheld sentence - Probation for 5 years
no alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's and breathalyzers

no contact with former employer or brother and sister-in-law or chiropractic agency unless approved by them and agent

on 1884 - withheld sentence - 2 years probation
same conditions as 1660 and concurrent to 1660.

180 days RCJ - Huber for work or school only.  Report-in date 10-8-16

Racine County Alternatives Program

Ct 1: 943.20(1)(b)-Theft-Business Setting. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, Ardagh Glass Inc., except for restitution purposes. No contact with the employees of Ardagh Glass Inc. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m. Defendant has until Dec. 30, 2015 to have this done.   Defendant is to confirm, in writing, with the Court that he is, in fact, accepted and living at HALO. If the defendant cannot live at HALO, he is to return to the Racine County Jail and bond will be returned to a cash bond. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Preliminary hearing at 12-30-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with victims, MA and Ardagh Glass, store except for restitution purposes.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
